net.sf.javaml.distance

Class AbstractCorrelation

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.javaml.distance.AbstractCorrelation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, DistanceMeasure
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PearsonCorrelationCoefficient, SpearmanRankCorrelation

    public abstract class AbstractCorrelation
extends java.lang.Object
implements DistanceMeasure
    Abstract super class for all correlation measures. A correlation measure quantifies the correlation between two instances. Values are in the range [-1,1]. One means perfect correlation, zero means no correlation and minus one means perfect inverse correlation.
    Author:
    Thomas Abeel (thomas@abeel.be)
    See Also:
    DistanceMeasure, AbstractSimilarity, AbstractDistance, Serialized Form

      • compare

        public boolean compare(double x,
              double y)
        Comparisons for correlation measures are done with the absolute value of the real values
        Specified by:
        compare in interface DistanceMeasure
        Parameters:
        x - the first distance, similarity or correlation
        y - the second distance, similarity or correlation
        Returns:
        true if the first distance is better than the second, false in other cases.

      • getMinValue

        public double getMinValue()
        Description copied from interface: DistanceMeasure
        Returns the value that this distance metric produces for the lowest distance or highest similarity. This is mainly useful to initialize variables to be used in comparisons with the compare method of this class.
        Specified by:
        getMinValue in interface DistanceMeasure
        Returns:
        minimum possible value of the distance metric

      • getMaxValue

        public double getMaxValue()
        Description copied from interface: DistanceMeasure
        Returns the value that this distance metric produces for the highest distance or lowest similarity. This is mainly useful to initialize variables to be used in comparisons with the compare method of this class.
        Specified by:
        getMaxValue in interface DistanceMeasure
        Returns:
        maximum possible value of the distance metric
